üîπ Has integrated @chainlink to prevent Oracle price manipulation

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz @AlphaFinanceLab üîπ Avalanche is EVM compatible as well
üîπ Already have exposure to Ethereum L2 through @zksync through @argentHQ wallet. Users can access their Vault products through Argent wallet

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz üîπ There has to be a deposit cap because it will reach a point where there‚Äôs not enough $AVAX to be borrowed and the remaining stablecoins will generate a lesser yield
üîπ Another point is that as the utilization rate goes up, the interest rate for borrowing $AVAX goes up as well

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz üîπ If Labs was open to all, they would hit a ceiling on the $AVAX borrowing capacity. Currently, $AVAX borrowing has a 90% utilization rate

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz Token gating

üîπ At launch, they have used 500 GRO tokens as a token gate
üîπ Wanted to make sure that the most committed DAO members get priority access to the high yields in Labs
üîπ Will be experimenting with different deposit caps for Labs https://t.co/Q8E9AvrAvL

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz üîπ The long-term yield is ~30-40% APY
üîπ Their strategy automates cutting loss when there‚Äôs a major pump or dump in the markets and reopening the positions when the price is back to trending within a more stable range

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz üîπ They have to sell off their excess AVAX or buy more AVAX with their excess stablecoin to pay off the loan
üîπ If users want to do leveraged yield farming, they need to manually do all this on their own. Labs monitors the exposure and automates all these operations for the users

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz üîπ When $AVAX price is out of that range, they close the position so as to avoid impermanent loss as AVAX price goes up or down
üîπ When users close their position, they end up having more or less $AVAX than when they initiated the position

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax @traderjoe_xyz üîπ On a regular basis, these incentives are sold off and converted into more yield, allowing the yield to compound further
üîπ Impermanent loss becomes a challenge here. They tackle the problem by setting a price range of $AVAX when the position is initiated https://t.co/UcaIaY4mXy

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ Stablecoin assets are used to borrow AVAX
üîπ The $AVAX is combined with stablecoins that the user has deposited and added into an AMM pool at @traderjoe_xyz to earn fees and other token incentives

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax Labs

üîπ Labs product is an even higher yielding set of strategies
üîπ Currently, it‚Äôs on @avalancheavax
üîπ This product does not have risk tranching built on top of them
üîπ Labs accept deposits in $USDC, $USDT, or $DAI https://t.co/a7PLkOUvNZ

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ The assumption is that the dollar prices of these assets are ~$1. Hence, there‚Äôs no impermanent loss as they tend to return to the peg
üîπ Their Labs product on Avalanche pairs a volatile asset with a stablecoin. Hence, IL becomes a very important thing to consider

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ A portfolio that is split into multiple assets and multiple strategies allows for a complete failure of an asset or protocol and still maintain protection because the higher risk side can subsidize the losses of the lower risk side

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ Otherwise, the failure of one protocol or one stablecoin will just wipe out both the low risk and high risk tranche

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ Withdrawals are made from overweighted stablecoins in the underlying pool in order to balance stablecoin proportions
üîπ Hence, the protocol is always driving towards a balanced distribution of assets into different stablecoins and protocols
@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ Risk tranching works by allocating any losses to one side in benefit of the other side

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ One strategy gets exploited. If there‚Äôs no risk tranching, both the high risk and the low risk person would have lost $1 each
üîπ With risk tranching, the high risk person would lose $2 while the low risk person would not lose anything

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax ELI5 version of risk tranching

üîπ There‚Äôs $10 in this product
üîπ Someone who doesn‚Äôt want a lot of risks puts in $5
üîπ Someone who wanted risk puts in $5
üîπ There are 5 different strategies, with $2 in each strategy https://t.co/NCFv3iCTl7

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax üîπ The leverage and protection built on top of yield generating strategies are unique products in the space
üîπ Labs contain a new set of strategies and some of those could be rolled into the main Vault and $PWRD

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax How does Gro standout amongst its competitors

üîπ Gro is a risk tranching protocol
üîπ The risk tranching on top of the yield provides leverage
üîπ The leveraged option has a higher yield than if you have the same type of strategies without the leverage option https://t.co/I5L4STi3Vq

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc @avalancheavax What assets can be used to earn yield on Gro?

üîπ Stablecoins like $USDC, $USDT, or $DAI
üîπ At the moment, they are a stablecoin protocol
üîπ Their $PWRD stablecoin has a built-in yield while being shielded from protocol exploits or stablecoin depegging https://t.co/Ur12hvz9Pj

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ Their community wanted an even higher yield
üîπ Two months ago, they launched Labs on @avalancheavax. Labs is an automated leveraged yield farming product üßë‚Äçüåæ

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ It also comes with protection if any of the underlying stablecoins/protocols fail
üîπ For users who are looking for a higher yield, they have Vault for them

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ They are gearing their protocol towards higher yielding strategies with a more aggressive risk profile for users who are risk-on while making sure those who prefer lower risk can still use PWRD

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ However, what they have seen is that people are quite risk-on and are interested in as much yield as possible
üîπ They are pitching their low risk product to DAO treasuries which have a more conservative risk profile

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ The low risk segment is akin to a high yield savings account. It gives up some of its yield as payment for getting that protection
üîπ The payment is given to the high risk tranche, which has more risk, but also more yield

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ One of the core mechanics of Gro Protocol is to split up their products into two categories ‚Äî one having a higher risk while the other having a lower risk https://t.co/7wK9LFyPKk

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ There are insurance protocols, but the coverage is only for a period of time
üîπ Wanted to create a DeFi-native way of deposit protection

@groprotocol @CRE8RDAO @graadient @Spotify @RevolutApp @joyceyyc üîπ He wanted to create a high yield savings account with deposit protection
üîπ Realized that there‚Äôs no DeFi equivalent of deposit protection
